intro: Lesquerella sessilis, commonly known as the sessile lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds contain a unique oil called lesquerolic acid, which has industrial and cosmetic applications. Lesquerella sessilis is also valued for its role in ecological systems, providing nectar for pollinators.
